description: Alteration of funk, or perhaps a blend of flinch +â€Ž funk.

verbs.description: flunk (third-person singular simple present flunks, present participle flunking, simple past and past participle flunked)

entries.meaning: (US, transitive, intransitive) Of a student, to fail a class; to not pass.
(US, transitive) Of a teacher, to deny a student a passing grade.
examples: Unsatisfied with Fred's progress, the teacher flunked him.

entries.meaning: (US, dated, informal) To shirk (a task or duty).
To back out through fear. (Commonly in the phrase 'flunk it', the 'it' referring to a specific task avoided;  sometimes without specific reference, describing a person's attitude to life in general.)
